title: Few showers expected in parts of the island
byline: A few showers may occur in Uva province and in Batticaloa, Ampara, Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Hambantota districts today (05), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Final rites of business icon Harry Jayawardena performed in Ja-Ela
byline: The funeral and final rites of prominent businessman Deshamanya Harry Jayawardena were held on Tuesday afternoon (04) at St. Francis Church in Wewala, Ja-Ela.

title: India’s Chandrika Tandon wins best new age album at Grammys 2025
byline: India-born Chandrika Krishnamoorthy Tandon has bagged the Grammy for her album Triveni under the category for the Best New Age, Ambient, or Chant Album at the award ceremony held in Los Angeles.

title: Trump says he wants US to take ownership of Gaza Strip
byline: President Donald Trump vowed on Tuesday that the U.S. would take over the war-ravaged Gaza Strip after Palestinians are resettled elsewhere and develop it economically, a move that would shatter decades of U.S. policy toward the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: Sweden’s deadliest attack leaves 11 dead at Orebro adult school
byline: Eleven people were killed in a shooting at an adult education centre on Tuesday, Swedish police said, marking the country’s deadliest gun attack in what the prime minister called a “painful day.”

title: Nearly 5,000 dengue cases reported before end of January
byline: The National Dengue Control Unit (NDCU) says that nearly 5,000 dengue cases have been reported in the country before the end of January this year (2025).

title: ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ will press forward with youths who can think anew – Dilith
byline: Leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance, Member of Parliament Dilith Jayaweera says that it is important to move forward with youths who are capable of thinking anew.

title: Woman files civil lawsuit for sexual assault against Neil Gaiman and ex-wife
byline: A woman has filed civil lawsuits against Neil Gaiman and his ex-wife in the US, accusing the British author of sexually assaulting her.

title: Namal calls for probe into USAID-funded projects and NGOs in Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa today called for an investigation into projects and grants operated under funding from the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) and local NGOs that have benefitted from such funding.

title: Labour Dept. introduces new AH registration system under EPF Act
byline: The Department of Labour has introduced a new member registration (AH Registration) system under the Employees’ Provident Fund Act.

title: Sri Lanka and Rwandan agree to expand trade, investment and knowledge exchange
byline: High Commissioner of the Republic of Rwanda to Sri Lanka based in New Delhi, Jacqueline Mukangira, paid a courtesy call on Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at the Prime Minister’s Office on Monday.

title: Trump and Netanyahu meet as internal pressure to end truce mounts for Israel
byline: President Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu are set to meet Tuesday as the Israeli prime minister faces competing pressure from his right-wing coalition to end a temporary truce against Hamas militants in Gaza and from war-weary Israelis who want the remaining hostages home and the 15-month conflict to end. More..

title: Four police officers including Weeraketiya OIC interdicted
byline: Four police officers including the officer-in-charge (OIC) of Weeraketiya Police Station, the Tangalle Crimes Division OIC, the Kamburupitiya Police Minor Offence Branch OIC and a Sergeant attached to the Mount Lavinia Police Station have been interdicted by the Acting IGP.

title: Water tariffs to be reduced by 30%?
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) says that steps will be taken to reduce water tariffs by 10% to 30% in the near future.

title: Sajith’s leadership to remain unchanged as SJB–UNP unification talks progress
byline: The General Secretary of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Ranjith Madduma Bandara says that his party will make significant progress in the upcoming elections.

title: CMC begins antibiotic vaccinations to animals after Beira Lake duck deaths
byline: The Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) has confirmed that a bacterial infection was the cause of multiple animal deaths in Beira Lake, Colombo.

title: New Chief of Staff of Sri Lanka Army appointed
byline: Major General Chandana Wickremasinghe has been appointed as the new Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Army.

title: Sri Lanka Customs seize ‘liquid cocaine’ for first time
byline: Sri Lanka Customs has discovered a stock of narcotics concealed within a suspicious parcel sent through a freight company in Colombo during routine screening procedures.

title: China plans to send flying robot to search for water on the moon’s far side
byline: China plans to send a flying robot to the far side of the moon next year to search for the frozen water that could hold the key to future lunar exploration, as the country pushes forward with its ambitious space program.

title: Trump administration puts on leave USAID staff globally in dramatic aid overhaul
byline: The Trump administration on Tuesday announced that it was going to put on leave all directly hired employees of the U.S. Agency for International Development globally and recall thousands of personnel working overseas.

title: Supreme Court verdict on LG Elections Bill not received yet - Speaker
byline: The Speaker of the Parliament Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne announced to the House this morning (05) that he is yet to receive the Supreme Court’s decision pertaining to the petitions filed challenging the Local Government Elections (Special Provisions) Bill.

title: Google erases promise not to use AI technology for weapons or surveillance
byline: Google’s updated, public AI ethics policy removes its promise that it won’t use the technology to pursue applications for weapons and surveillance.

title: SC informed of govt’s decision on Online Safety Act
byline: The Attorney General’s Department has informed the Supreme Court that the incumbent government has decided to introduce several new amendments to the Online Safety Act, which was passed under the previous administration.

title: Govt. announces prices for paddy purchase
byline: The government has officially announced the prices at which the Paddy Marketing Board (PMB) will purchase paddy from farmers, in a special media briefing held today (05).

title: Malinga’s plea to cricket fans for Dimuth Karunaratne’s final Test
byline: Sri Lankan cricketing legend Lasith Malinga has urged fans to rally behind former Test captain Dimuth Karunaratne as he prepares to play his final Test match tomorrow (06).

title: Japan reaffirms commitment to assist Sri Lanka’s development journey
byline: Parliamentary Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs of Japan, Ms. Akiko Ikuina paid a courtesy call on Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at Temple Trees, yesterday (04).

title: Sri Lanka to sign amended debt restructuring agreement and exchange papers with Japan
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the signing of the exchange papers between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Japan and amended agreement between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) relevant to the process of restructuring of foreign debts.

title: Passport Office to operate 24 hours a day to issue 4,000 passports daily
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has greenlighted the supplying of additional staff required for accelerating the printing of passports.

title: Cabinet nod to import coconut kernel-related products equivalent to 200M coconuts
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to import a capacity equal to 200 million coconuts of coconut kernel-related products and dried coconut pieces with coconut (non–copra) husks for manufacturing coconut oil adhering to the guidelines.

title: Opposition party leaders hold talks on collaboration and future strategies
byline: The leaders of all major opposition parties represented in Parliament convened a meeting today (05) at the Opposition Leader’s Office in Parliament for a critical discussion on future political affairs, including parliamentary strategies.

title: Sri Lanka moves to modernize outdated public service regulations
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to review and simplify the existing rules and regulations in the public service through obtaining ideas and proposals from the relevant officers and the public.

title: MPs to pay Rs. 2,000 for meals starting today
byline: Members of Parliament will be required to pay Rs. 2,000 per day for their meals from today onwards.

title: Govt. reviewing AG’s recommendation on Lasantha murder case
byline: The government has stated that it is currently reviewing the recommendation made by the Attorney General regarding the suspects involved in the murder of Sri Lankan journalist Lasantha Wickrematunge.

title: Will govt provide vehicles for MPs? – Cabinet Spokesman clarifies
byline: Cabinet Spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa has confirmed that vehicle permits will not be provided to Members of Parliament under the incumbent government and that however there are plans to provide them with a vehicle to help carry out their duties.

title: Stock market slumps as ASPI drops by over 500 points
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) and the S&P SL20 of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) have both dropped significantly at the close of trading today (05).

title: Philippine vice president impeached by House, faces Senate trial
byline: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte was impeached by the House of Representatives Wednesday after more than the required number of legislators, many of them allies of the president with whom she has had a bitter political feud, signed a petition to remove her from office.

title: C.B. Ratnayake ordered to pay Rs. 250M to Senasinghe in defamation case
byline: The Mount Lavinia District Court has ordered former Minister C.B. Ratnayake to pay Rs. 250 million in compensation for defaming Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Sujeewa Senasinghe during a televised talk show related to the Central Bank bond scam.

title: Vehicle dealer arrested over illegally importing and registering luxury SUV
byline: A vehicle dealer has been arrested on charges of aiding and abetting corruption by unlawfully importing a Toyota Land Cruiser into the country and illegally registering it with the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT).

title: UN hails govt’s efforts in poverty alleviation, digitalization and ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ initiative
byline: The United Nations (UN) Resident Coordinator in Sri Lanka, Mr. Marc-Andre Franche, has paid a courtesy call on Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at Temple Trees in Colombo.

title: Australia bans DeepSeek on government devices citing security concerns
byline: Australia has banned DeepSeek from all government devices over concerns that the Chinese artificial intelligence startup poses security risks, the government said on Tuesday.

title: Taliban raids and suspends Afghanistan’s only women’s radio station
byline: The Taliban suspended the operation of Afghanistan’s only women’s radio station after raiding its premises on Tuesday, deepening the exclusion of women from public life and society since the group took power in 2021.

title: UAE expresses interest to invest in Sri Lanka’s energy sector
byline: A meeting has been held between the Ambassador of the United Arab Emirates to Sri Lanka, Khaled Nasser AlAmeri and Sri Lanka’s Minister of Energy, Kumara Jayakody.

title: Colombo HC issues notice on MP Namal Rajapaksa
byline: The Colombo High Court has issued a notice on SLPP Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa to appear before court on February 18 over charges of criminal misappropriation of Rs. 70 million in connection with the controversial ‘Krrish’ project.

title: Sri Lanka sees record tourist arrivals in January 2025
byline: The month of January 2025 has set a new record for the highest number of tourists arrivals in Sri Lanka in a single month.

title: President to visit UAE to attend ‘World Government Summit 2025’
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayaka will undertake a visit to the United Arab Emirates (UAE) from 10 to 13 February 2025 at the invitation of President of the UAE Mohamed Bin Zayed Al Nahyan to participate in the ‘World Government Summit 2025’.

title: US Embassy issues special notice for visa applicants
byline: The United States Embassy in Colombo has issued a special notice to Sri Lankan visa applicants to the US.
